availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Kentucky native. Married to Polly Ragland in Bath County, Kentucky, on December 2, 1829.
Married to Jane Estill in Bath County on March 5, 1851. Married to Margaret Martin. Father of John D. Martin and William S. Martin. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Employed Samuel Estill as farm hand in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860. Household owned one additional slave in 1860. Served in the 9th Cavalry Cavalry (C.S.A.) as private from September 15, 1862. Reported as missing from Woodbury, Tennessee, May 1, 1863.
